SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Dural sinus malformations are rare congenital forms of dural arteriovenous shunt
Our goal is to describe prenatal ultrasonography and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) findings of a thrombosed midline dural venous malformation

CASE: Second-trimester fetal ultrasonography and MRI demonstrated a large T2-hypointense mass centered at the level of the torcular Herophili consistent with complete thrombosis of a dural sinus malformation
A follow-up third-trimester MRI showed decreased thrombus size and no parenchymal injury
A neurologically intact newborn was delivered
CONCLUSION: Dural sinus malformations can lead to fetal intracranial thrombosis
Prenatal imaging is useful to establish the diagnosis of dural sinus malformations and to plan perinatal management and treatment options
